title: What is happening here? Unwind Execution / Wrong trie root
body:
It's taking forever to sync blocks 17M to 18M. Progressively slower as it approaches 17M.

```
[z@rack1-21 ~]$ journalctl -u erigon -n 2000000 | grep "Unwind Execution"

node goes wild o_O 

version? chain name? is it sync from scratch or start from backup? 

try: 
- stop erigon 
- integration stage_hash_state --reset
- integration stage_trie --reset
- integration stage_hash_state
- integration stage_trie
- if no errors - start erigon as usually. if errors, will see.

- mainnet
- erigon version 2.48.1-stable-674b77f0
- sync from scratch

Everything worked until `integration stage_trie`:
```
INFO[08-25|11:23:27.283] [9/15 IntermediateHashes] Calculating Merkle root current key=fe1c2c3b
INFO[08-25|11:23:48.954] [9/15 IntermediateHashes] Regeneration ended 
EROR[08-25|11:23:48.955] [9/15 IntermediateHashes] Wrong trie root of block 17006143: dffafa09102a85598d8fc178f1c1ec23cf6ab7ad51c2ec08b08ed6c993db41fd, expected (from header): 2475cab68da4e24f622671ac8a587a51eebff66f6736112ddb6f316a732668ee. This issue is stale because it has been open for 40 days with no activity. Remove stale label or comment, or this will be closed in 7 days.
